data.description: <div><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.</span></p><p class="pf0"> </p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0"><strong>What’s in it for you:</strong></span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">Be a part of our mission! As a world leader in creating comfortable, sustainable, and efficient environments, it’s our responsibility to put the planet first. For us at Trane Technologies, sustainability is not just how we do business</span><span class="cf1">—it is our business. Do you dare to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities? Do you want to contribute to making a better future? If the answer is yes, we invite you to consider joining us in boldly challenging what’s possible for a sustainable world.</span></p><p class="pf0"> </p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0"><strong>Job Summary</strong></span><span class="cf2"><strong>：</strong></span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">Work with the Business Operations Support team to assist Trane North America with process improvement and development. Responsibilities include software application set up, testing, implementation, process support, troubleshooting application problems, developing user training and creating user instructions and support documentation for Trane field sales office and manufacturing applications.</span></p><p class="pf0"> </p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0"><strong>Where is the work:</strong></span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">On-Site (5 days)</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">From Monday to Thursday, work onsite with your colleagues. On Fridays, choose your work location, balancing what your work requires</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">Prioritize engaging with customers. When not directly interacting with customers; collaborate with colleagues in your office</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0">This is a virtual position</span></p><p class="pf0"> </p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf0"><strong>What you will do:</strong></span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Provide customer service to field, manufacturing and internal customers on a daily basis.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Work with team to continually develop business processes and system enhancements.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Understand integrated business systems configuration options and tools.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Identify application problems and provide resolutions in a timely manner.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Provide training and support of end users for Trane North America.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Update user training and documentation for specific business processes.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Develop and manage process improvement plans in regard to specific business processes.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Observe and document any malfunction of the software and offer reasonable solutions for correction.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Work with other groups within Trane to establish best practices and implement management strategy.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Work closely with Trane Technologies Corporate IT, Trane Operations teams, Manufacturing Plants, Americas Accounting Center, Climate Solutions Application Owners, and third party technology vendors.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Assist with application requirements and lead user acceptance testing for the application deployment process.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Assist in developing tools for offices to monitor and measure processes including report definitions and data validation.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Work on ad hoc project teams to further define processes/systems.</span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">• Up to 10% travel to various Trane and/or vendor field sites required.</span></p><p class="pf0"> </p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1"><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity:</strong></span></p><p class="pf0"><span class="cf1">We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.</span></p></div>
